title: General
stimulusHtml:
Student response can earn up to 7 points:

2a (4 possible points)

1 point

Characterization of Greeks through Ulysses.

Deceitful, tricky, crafty; a liar; untrustworthy; representative of all Greeks.

1 point

Latin reference: insania, creditis, dolis, the mention of Danaum and Ulixes in the same line.

1 point

Correct translation/paraphrase of the Latin.

1 point

Connection: Clear statement of the connection between the characterization of Ulysses and the Latin cited.

2b (3 possible points)

2 points

The dona refer to the horse, a donum that the Greeks (through Sinon) claim is a gift/offering to Minerva. The event is the giving of the horse and/or the destruction of Troy because of the gift.

1 point

The Trojan horse (the Trojan horse in not an event). The Trojan War.
